intro: Chorizanthe cuspidata, commonly known as the spikeless prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, leafless stems and showy, red to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky habitats. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Chorizanthe cuspidata is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
